meanings.definition: Ginches (noun): A unit of measurement equal to one hundredth of an inch.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was so delicate that even a few ginches made a big difference.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter measured the width of the board in ginches to ensure precision.
meanings.sent3: The tailor needed to cut the cloth with accuracy down to the ginches.
meanings.sent4: The artist's attention to detail was so fine that he could distinguish between ginches.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler crafted the intricate design with measurements accurate to the ginches.

meanings.definition: Ginches (verb): To move quickly or suddenly in a jerky or unpredictable manner.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel ginches across the branches to reach its nest.
meanings.sent2: The cat ginches after the elusive mouse in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's feet seemed to ginches effortlessly across the stage.
meanings.sent4: The car ginches forward as the driver steps on the gas pedal.
meanings.sent5: The athlete ginches past the finish line, winning the race.

meanings.definition: Ginches (adjective): Describing something as small or insignificant in size.
meanings.sent1: The ginches pebbles on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She found a ginches bug crawling on the leaf in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The tiny flower in the vase was a ginches touch of color in the room.
meanings.sent4: His ginches contribution to the project turned out to be crucial.
meanings.sent5: The kitten played with a ginches ball of yarn, batting it around playfully.
